text: Rodes Rollins is an American singer-songwriter from Boulder, CO who is currently based in Brooklyn, NY but also spends time in LA and Mexico City. She calls her Americana, pop-esque music “cowboy poetry” and Billboard has referred to her sound as “part spaghetti western, part psychedelic.” She released her debut EP "Young Adult", which was produced by Alex Goose, in 2016. One song from the EP, 'Wes Come Back,' was featured on the CW's Riverdale. Rollins has collaborated with Stella Mozgawa, Matthew Compton of Electric Guest, Kane Ritchotte (formerly of Portugal. The Man), and Greg Rogove. She was also featured in Branko’s “Out of Sight (So Right).” Rollins studied Cultural Iconography at NYU Gallatin School of Individualized Study. == References == Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Musicians from Boulder, Colorado Category:Musicians from Brooklyn Category:Singers from Los Angeles Category:Singers from Mexico City Category:Americana musicians Category:New York University alumni
title: Rodes Rollins
